title: Xiaomi India crosses the $1 billion revenue mark within just 2 years
text:
Xiaomi India crosses the $1 billion revenue mark within just 2 years Xiaomi India crosses the $1 billion revenue mark within just 2 years By January 5, 2017 “Xiaomi recently announced it sold over 2 million smartphones in India in Q3 2016” 
Xiaomi has announced that its revenue in India crossed $1 billion, around Rs 6,800 crores, in 2016. The company achieved the milestone within two years of starting its operations here. The announcement came soon after the brand revealed that it sold over one million smartphones in the country in 18 days, and over two million in Q3 2016. 
Xiaomi claims it is the first smartphone company in India to cross $1 billion in revenue within two years of operation. The company says that as per IDC, the Redmi Note 3 was the highest shipped phone in the history of the online smartphone industry, with more than 2.3 million units sold in six months. 
Xiaomi also revealed that the Redmi 3S , Redmi 3S Prime ( review ) and Redmi Note 3 were the bestseller devices during Flipkart’s Big Billion Days and Amazon’s Diwali Shopping Festival last year. These phones together account for close to 50 percent of the market share among the top 10 smartphones in the country. Facebook Comments
